com.eis.greenenergy.help

Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eis.greenenergy.help.UserManager

  • public class UserManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Very important auxiliary class, which manages the user's data, as well as the energy data which is displayed to the user.
    Moreover this class manages nearly the whole data structure of the application and controls the access to most Async-tasks.
    Since:
    2014-05-30
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Veronika Henk, Sarvenaz Golchin, Mahnaz Hajibaba

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserManager

        public UserManager(Context context)
        In this constructor the context of the calling activity is assigned to the class variable context.
        The method isloggedin() is called and its result is assigned to the boolean variable loggedIn. Moreover the constructor assigns a SharedPreferences instance of the activity.
        The boolean class variable increased represents whether the user increased his score; as the score has not increased when the constructor is called, the value false is assigned to it.
        Furthermore, messages are assigned to the class variables TWEET and FIRSTTWEET, which represent the tweets which can be published on Twitter using this application.
        Parameters:
        context - Context of the activity creating an instance of UserManager.

    • Method Detail

      • isloggedin

        private boolean isloggedin()
        Returns a boolean value to express whether the user is already logged in.
        Moreover, this function checks whether the user's data is already stored on the device. Using the Async-Task SyncScore the user data stored on the device is verified by comparing it to the user data stored on the external database. Furthermore the Async-Task SyncScore returns the current score of the user if it can be accessed successfully. Within this method this score is assigned to the class variable score.
        Returns:
        true if the user's data was verified successfully and his score was accessed;
        false otherwise.

      • isTwitterLoggedInAlready

        public boolean isTwitterLoggedInAlready()
        Returns a boolean value to indicate whether the user is already logged into Twitter or not.
        Returns:
        true if the twitter login status in SharedPreferences is true;
        false otherwise.

      • loginToTwitter

        public twitter4j.Twitter loginToTwitter()
        Logs the user into Twitter if he is not logged in already. If the user is already logged in and if his score is not 0, his score is published on Twitter. Otherwise if the the user is already logged in and he does not have any score, a message is published on Twitter, which is not mentioning the score.
        Returns:
        Twitter variable if the user was not logged in before;
        null if the user was logged in already.

      • writeScore

        public boolean writeScore(int newscore)
        Updates the user's score in the external database, using the AsyncTask ScoreStorage.
        Parameters:
        newscore - Updated number of the user's score.
        Returns:
        true if the score value was updated successfully;
        false otherwise.

      • scoreincreased

        public boolean scoreincreased()
        Indicates whether the user's score has increased in order to display a Toast message.
        Returns:
        Boolean variable increased, which is true if the user's score has increased.

      • accessdata

        public java.lang.String[] accessdata(java.lang.String time)
        Retrieves energy data necessary for the application's main view using the Async-Task EnergyNowAccess.
        Parameters:
        time - Current point of time.
        Returns:
        null if the data could not be accessed successfully;
        otherwise the string array energydata[], which contains the accessed energy data itself.
        In detail, energydata[0] = current energy amount,
        energydata[1] = prediction for energy amount in 1 hour,
        energydata[2] = prediction for energy amount in 3 hours,
        energydata[3] = prediction for energy amount in 4 hours.

      • getPredictions

        public java.lang.String[][] getPredictions(java.lang.String time)
        Gets the energy data predictions for the next 10 hours following time.
        This method accesses predictions for the amount of green energy using the Async-Task Predictions. Depending on the amount of green energy for each hour, a color is assigned. Color, percentage, and formatted percentage are stored in the 2-dimensional array predictionentry.
        In other words, this method generates entries for the ListView, which is displayed on the detail view of this application.
        Parameters:
        time - Current point of time.
        Returns:
        null if something went wrong accessing the data;
        otherwise 2-dimensional string array with 10 entries,
        with predictionentry[i][0] = formatted energy prediction data for the next 10 hours,
        predictionentry[i][1] = background color for this entry depending on the green energy amount,
        predictionentry[i][2] = energy prediction data without formatting, so that it can be parsed into a double-variable.

      • getLoggedIn

        public boolean getLoggedIn()
        Indicates if the user is logged in, or not.
        Delivers the result of the method isloggedin(), which was called from the constructor of this class.
        Returns:
        Class variable loggedIn.
